Notice type: Notice of the publication of a prior information notice or a periodic information notice on a buyer profile
Definition: Announcement of intentions of planned procurements.Contracting authorities may make known their intentions of planned procurements through the publication of a prior information notice. Those notices shall contain the information set out in Annex V part B section I. They shall be published either by the Publications Office of the European Union or by the contracting authorities on their buyer profiles in accordance with point 2(b) of Annex VIII . Where the prior information notice is published by the contracting authorities on their buyer profile, they shall send a notice of the publication on their buyer profile to the Publications Office of the European Union in accordance with Annex VIII. Those notices shall contain the information set out in Annex V part A. [Directive 2014/24/EU]
Notice description: Notice of the publication of a prior information notice on a buyer profile — general directive

Those notices shall contain the information set out in Annex V part A. [Directive 2014/24/EU]
Notice description: Notice of the publication of a periodic indicative notice on a buyer profile — sectoral directive

Related article: Art. 27(2) of Directive 2014/24/EU, Art. 28(3) of Directive 2014/24/EU
Notice type: Prior information notice or a periodic indicative notice used to shorten time limits for receipt of tenders
Definition: Announcement of intentions of planned procurements in view orf shortening time limits for reception of tenders.Where contracting authorities have published a prior information notice which was not itself used as a means of calling for competition, the minimum time limit for the receipt of tenders, as laid down in the second subparagraph of paragraph 1 of this Article, may be shortened to 15 days, [...].
Notice description: Prior information notice used to shorten time limits for receipt of tenders — general directive

Notice type: Prior information notice or a periodic indicative notice used to shorten time limits for receipt of tenders
Definition: Announcement of intentions of planned procurements in view orf shortening time limits for reception of tenders.Where contracting authorities have published a prior information notice which was not itself used as a means of calling for competition, the minimum time limit for the receipt of tenders, as laid down in the second subparagraph of paragraph 1 of this Article, may be shortened to 15 days, [...].
Notice description: Periodic indicative notice used to shorten time limits for receipt of tenders — sectoral directive

Notice description: Prior information notice used to shorten time limits for receipt of tenders — defence directive

Definition: Announcement of intentions of planned procurements used as a call for competion.For restricted procedures and competitive procedures with negotiation, sub-central contracting authorities may use a prior information notice as a call for competition pursuant to Article 26(5), [...]. [Directive 2014/24/EU]
Notice description: Prior information notice used as a call for competition — general directive, standard regime

Definition: Announcement of intentions of planned procurements used as a call for competion concerning contracts for social and other specific services

Related article: Art. 68 of Directive 2014/25/EU, Art. 92(1)(c) of Directive 2014/25/EU
Notice type: Notice on the existence of a qualification system
Definition: Announcement of a system of qualification of economic operators on the basis of exclusion and selection criteria. The announcement can be used as a call for competition.When a call for competition is made by means of a notice on the existence of a qualification system, specific contracts for the works, supplies or services covered by the qualification system shall be awarded by restricted procedures or negotiated procedures, in which all tenderers and participants are selected among the candidates already qualified in accordance with such a system
Notice description: Notice on the existence of a qualification system — sectoral directive

Notice type: Contract or concession notice – standard regime
Definition: Announcement of a call for competition concerning contracts or concessions.Contract notices shall be used as a means of calling for competition in respect of all procedures, without prejudice to the second subparagraph of Article 26(5) and Article 32. Contract notices shall contain the information set out in Annex V part C and shall be published in accordance with Article 51. [Directive 2014/24/EU]
Notice description: Contract notice — general directive, standard regime

Notice type: Contract or concession notice – standard regime
Definition: Announcement of a call for competition concerning contracts or concessions.Contract notices shall be used as a means of calling for competition in respect of all procedures, without prejudice to the second subparagraph of Article 26(5) and Article 32. Contract notices shall contain the information set out in Annex V part C and shall be published in accordance with Article 51. [Directive 2014/24/EU]

Definition: Announcement of a call for competition concerning contracts for social and other specific services.

Definition: Announcement of a call for competition concerning contracts for social and other specific services.

Notice type: Subcontracting notice
Definition: Announcement of a call for competition by successful tenderers which are not contracting authorities/entities concerning contracts for social and other specific services.
Notice description: Subcontract notice — defence directive

Notice type: Design contest notice
Definition: Announcement of a call for competition concerning the aquisition, mainly in the fields of town and country planning, architecture and engineering or data processing, of a plan or design selected by a jury.Contracting authorities that intend to carry out a design contest shall make known their intention by means of a contest notice.Where they intend to award a subsequent service contract pursuant to Article 32(4), this shall be indicated in the contest notice. [Directive 2014/24/EU]
Notice description: Design contest notice — general directive, design

Notice type: Design contest notice
Definition: Announcement of a call for competition concerning the aquisition, mainly in the fields of town and country planning, architecture and engineering or data processing, of a plan or design selected by a jury.Contracting authorities that intend to carry out a design contest shall make known their intention by means of a contest notice.Where they intend to award a subsequent service contract pursuant to Article 32(4), this shall be indicated in the contest notice. [Directive 2014/24/EU]
Notice description: Design contest notice — sectoral directive, design

Notice type: Voluntary ex-ante transparency notice
Definition: Announcement of the intention to award of a contract without prior publication of a contract notice in the Official Journal of the European Union.
Notice description: Voluntary ex-ante transparency notice — general directive

Definition: Announcement of the intention to award of a contract without prior publication of a contract notice in the Official Journal of the European Union.

Notice type: Contract or concession award notice – standard regime
Definition: Announcement of the results of a call for competition concerning contracts or concessions.Not later than 30 days after the conclusion of a contract or of a framework agreement, following the decision to award or conclude it, contracting authorities shall send a contract award notice on the results of the procurement procedure.Such notices shall contain the information set out in Annex V part D and shall be published in accordance with Article 51
Notice description: Contract award notice — general directive, standard regime

Notice type: Contract or concession award notice – standard regime
Definition: Announcement of the results of a call for competition concerning contracts or concessions.Not later than 30 days after the conclusion of a contract or of a framework agreement, following the decision to award or conclude it, contracting authorities shall send a contract award notice on the results of the procurement procedure.Such notices shall contain the information set out in Annex V part D and shall be published in accordance with Article 51
Notice description: Contract award notice — sectoral directive, standard regime

Notice description: Contract award notice — defence directive, standard regime

Related article: Art. 32(2) (reference to Annex VII) of Directive 2014/23/EU

Notice type: Design contest result notice
Definition: Announcement of the results of a call for competition concerning the aquisition, mainly in the fields of town and country planning, architecture and engineering or data processing, of a plan or design selected by a jury.Contracting authorities that have held a design contest shall send a notice of the results of the contest in accordance with Article 51 and shall be able to prove the date of dispatch.
Notice description: Design contest result notice — general directive, design

Notice type: Design contest result notice
Definition: Announcement of the results of a call for competition concerning the aquisition, mainly in the fields of town and country planning, architecture and engineering or data processing, of a plan or design selected by a jury.Contracting authorities that have held a design contest shall send a notice of the results of the contest in accordance with Article 51 and shall be able to prove the date of dispatch.
Notice description: Design contest result notice — sectoral directive, design

Notice type: Contract modification notice
Definition: Announcement of modifications to a contract during its term.Contracts and framework agreements may be modified without a new procurement procedure in accordance with Directive 2014/24/EU.
Notice description: Contract modification notice — general directive

Notice type: Contract modification notice
Definition: Announcement of modifications to a contract during its term.Contracts and framework agreements may be modified without a new procurement procedure in accordance with Directive 2014/24/EU.
Notice description: Contract modification notice — sectoral directive

Notice type: Contract modification notice
Definition: Announcement of modifications to a contract during its term.Contracts and framework agreements may be modified without a new procurement procedure in accordance with Directive 2014/24/EU.

Notice number: any other standard form and the Notice and Change sections from Table 2
Related article: changing any of the notices listed above

Definition: Information about changes to the notice. This information may differ per section of the previous notice.
